      void recursion(java.lang.String word, int currentLetterIndex, int currentRow, int currentCol, Letter[][] board, int previousRow, int previousCol, int prevPrevRow, int prevPrevCol)
      The recursion algorithm compares the current string to the word and adds words that are not repeats to possibleWordList; the recursion alogrithm keeps track of each word and determines whether the currentString can add another letter to match the given word; it also keeps track of previous indexes so it makes words that do not use letters from already used columns and rows.

      The class passes through the dictionary text file arr and checks for letters within the board class.

      • isRepeat

        public boolean isRepeat(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> list,
                        java.lang.String key)
        Parameters:
        list - an ArrayList of Strings that are part of the possibleWordList
        key - the String that is possibly being added to list
        Returns:
        whether or not the key is a repeat word within the list 
        returns true if the key parameter is found within the list parameter and false otherwise.

      • scanList

        public void scanList(java.lang.String[] arr,
                     Letter[][] board)
         The class passes through the dictionary text file arr and checks for letters within the board class.
 If a board has the first letter of board in the board 2D array; if the letter is found, the index
 variable of the current string will be incremented and the recursion method that checks for all combinations
 of the possible words
        Parameters:
        arr - the array of dictionary words from a text file
        board - board of Letters

      • recursion

        public void recursion(java.lang.String word,
                      int currentLetterIndex,
                      int currentRow,
                      int currentCol,
                      Letter[][] board,
                      int previousRow,
                      int previousCol,
                      int prevPrevRow,
                      int prevPrevCol)
         The recursion algorithm compares the current string to the word and adds words that are not repeats
 to possibleWordList; the recursion alogrithm keeps track of each word and determines whether the
 currentString can add another letter to match the given word; it also keeps track of previous indexes
 so it makes words that do not use letters from already used columns and rows.
        Parameters:
        word - the word being matched with in the algorithm
        currentLetterIndex - the index of word
        currentRow - the current row of the 2D array
        currentCol - the current col of an array
        board - the 2D board of letters
        previousRow - the row of the previous recursion method; is -1 if none existed
        previousCol - the col of the previous recursion method; is -1 if none existed
        prevPrevRow - the row of the row of the previous recursion method; is -1 if none existed
        prevPrevCol - the col of the col of the previous recursion method; is -1 if none existed

      • hasWords

        public static void hasWords(Letter[][] letters,
                            java.lang.String s,
                            int r,
                            int c)
          The other recursive algorithm that adds words from the dictionary file if on the board
        Parameters:
        letters - the 2D array of letters used
        s - the string of the word being checked for
        r - the current row of the board
        c - the current col of the board
